title: What should I learn before I get into quantum computing research and development? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thermodynamics - and then you will see why quantum computing is a waste of time. Michael Price's answer to Once quantum computers are built, will the speedup obtained by Grover’s algorithm be useful for practical applications despite being "merely" quadratic, or is Grover speedup more academically interesting than useful in practice?

If you are still interested in quantum computing after reading the other answers, a more direct answer to your question is: quantum physics. If your math background is limited but our are still interested, you might have a look at https://uwaterloo.ca/institute-for-quantum-computing/sites/ca.institute-for-quantum-computing/files/uploads/files/mathematics_qm_v21.pdf.
